content:
/>
IV.i.3.B.1.i
.
Nerves Examination Report Review
Examiners must, to the extent possible, identify the nerve that best correlates to the area affected even if the condition is a spinal cord nerve condition.
This information will allow the rating decision to address the functional impairment of the area affected.
Reference
:  For more information on diseases of the peripheral nerves, see
38 CFR 4.120
, and
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 12.A.2
.
title: M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section B - Examination Sufficiency for Specific Disabilities
citation: Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section B
